title: ICE: panicked at 'compiler/rustc_resolve/src/macros.rs:892:21: inconsistent resolution for a macro'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: A-macros
labels.description: Area: All kinds of macros (custom derive, macro_rules!, proc macros, ..)

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code ```Rust core::panic!(); macro_rules! define_other_core { ( ) => { extern crate std as core; }; } define_other_core!(); ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.49.0-nightly (7bade6ef7 2020-10-23) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7bade6ef730cff83f3591479a98916920f66decd commit-date: 2020-10-23 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.49.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: macros that expand to items must be delimited with braces or followed by a semicolon --> reduced_mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | core::panic!(); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: expected one of `!` or `::`, found `(` --> reduced_mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | core::panic!(); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | | | expected one of `!` or `::` | in this macro invocation | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: macro-expanded `extern crate` items cannot shadow names passed with `--extern` --> reduced_mutant.rs:4:9 | 4 | extern crate std as core; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ... 7 | define_other_core!(); | --------------------- in this macro invocation | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'compiler/rustc_resolve/src/macros.rs:892:21: inconsistent resolution for a macro', /rustc/7bade6ef730cff83f3591479a98916920f66decd/compiler/rustc_middle/src/util/bug.rs:34:26 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0-nightly (7bade6ef7 2020-10-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 3 previous errors ```
Backtrace

``` error: macros that expand to items must be delimited with braces or followed by a semicolon --> reduced_mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | core::panic!(); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: expected one of `!` or `::`, found `(` --> reduced_mutant.rs:1:1 | 1 | core::panic!(); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | | | expected one of `!` or `::` | in this macro invocation | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) error: macro-expanded `extern crate` items cannot shadow names passed with `--extern` --> reduced_mutant.rs:4:9 | 4 | extern crate std as core; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ ... 7 | define_other_core!(); | --------------------- in this macro invocation | = note: this error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'compiler/rustc_resolve/src/macros.rs:892:21: inconsistent resolution for a macro', /rustc/7bade6ef730cff83f3591479a98916920f66decd/compiler/rustc_middle/src/util/bug.rs:34:26 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 2: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 3: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 4: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 5: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt 6: rustc_resolve::macros::::finalize_macro_resolutions::{{closure}} 7: rustc_resolve::Resolver::resolve_crate 8: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand_inner 9: rustc_interface::passes::configure_and_expand::{{closure}} 10: rustc_data_structures::box_region::PinnedGenerator::new 11: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::expansion 12: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 13: rustc_span::with_source_map 14: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 15: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.49.0-nightly (7bade6ef7 2020-10-23) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu query stack during panic: end of query stack error: aborting due to 3 previous errors ```

**NOTE: The bug is found by our work-in-progress compiler testing tool Kira, and the test program is reduced/minimized by [Perses](https://github.com/chengniansun/perses)**
